alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 12:01PM EDT until May 02 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Belknap and Grafton Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Faster flows along the river are expected but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river should continue to monitor later forecasts. High risks for recreational paddlers. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding as Moat Brook backs up and floods Transvale Road, cutting off access to a dozen homes and camps. Beaches at area camps flooded. At 8.0 feet, Flooding begins along the east bank campgrounds in Conway and North Conway. Campers along the river should move to higher ground. At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding of low-bottom fields and private roads in Conway and North Conway. Minor flooding in Transvale Acres, Moat Brook Bridge, and the lower part of E. Road flood. At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters surround properties across Transvale Acres. Flood waters 1 to 2 feet deep in sections of east bank camping areas. At 11.0 feet, Flood waters 2 to 3 feet deep at east bank camping areas. At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters reach West Side Road. Much of Transvale Acres floods from Moat Brook Bridge east to the Saco River. Numerous structures become flooded with buildings on campgrounds flooded by several feet. Campers should move to higher grounds. At 13.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs on West Side Road in two sections, cutting off access to hundreds of homes. River Road flooded on the west bank impacting agricultural lands. Floodwaters inundate first floors of properties in Transvale Acres. This is a dangerous situation at riverside campgrounds. At 14.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs along the west bank of the Saco River near Moat Brook Road, cutting off access to some homes. Flood waters enter agricultural lands in eastern Conway and into Freyburg. At 15.0 feet, Major flooding occurs in Conway and North Conway. Flood waters come up to properties off West Side Road in Conway Village. Transvale Acres severely impacted with flood water several feet deep. Permanent buildings on area campgrounds become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 12.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning to 7.2 feet Tuesday evening. It will rise to 7.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
